channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI can make anyone rich: Mark Cuban says it could turn ‘just one dude in a basement’ into a trillionaire
item.description: The billionaire former "Shark Tank" star and Dallas Mavericks owner is a dedicated AI user.

item.title: Netflix’s Best, Overlooked New Show Has A 96% Rotten Tomatoes Score
item.description: Netflix's best new show is an absurdist comedy with a 96% Rotten Tomatoes score and a wild ride across five seasons you will not forget.

item.title: Out Of Sight, Out Of Mind Is A Strategy With Lasting Repercussions
item.description: A documentary about half a million barrels of toxic waste dumped off the California coast reminds us that what we choose not to see doesn't stop being...

item.title: A Psychologist Shares A Test To Uncover Your ‘Truth-Bending Style’
item.description: Everyone bends the truth differently. Find out if you're a protective embellisher, a strategic omitter or another kind of liar entirely.

item.title: No, judge tells Trump. You can’t cripple $16 billion in funding for New York City and New Jersey
item.description: "Plaintiffs have adequately shown that the public interest would be harmed by a delay in a critical infrastructure project.”

item.title: Before Kevin Warsh has even taken over as Fed chair, Trump is joking about suing him. Scott Bessent is fine with that
item.description: When asked about Bessent's remarks, Sen. Thom Tillis said: “even stipulating that that could happen and that it’s not a bad idea is troubling to me.”

item.title: Weight-Loss Drugs Are Eating Our Lunch. We Can Fight Back

item.title: Ilhan Omar’s husband is rich. The Republican oversight chairman is investigating why
item.description: James Comer's request marked a highly unusual move by the chair of a committee with a history of taking on politically charged investigations.

item.title: Quordle Hints And Answers For Sunday, February 8

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
